verses.kjv: Cry aloud, spare not, lift up thy voice like a trumpet, and shew my people their transgression, and the house of Jacob their sins.
verses.ct: Shout with everything you have! Don't hold back! Raise your voice like a trumpet and declare to my people their rebellion, and to the house of Jacob their sins.

verses.kjv: Yet they seek me daily, and delight to know my ways, as a nation that did righteousness, and forsook not the ordinance of their God: they ask of me the ordinances of justice; they take delight in approaching to God.
verses.ct: Day after day they come looking for me, acting eager to understand my ways — as if they were a nation that practiced righteousness and never abandoned the commands of their God. They ask me for just rulings; they act thrilled to draw near to God.

verses.kjv: Wherefore have we fasted, say they, and thou seest not? wherefore have we afflicted our soul, and thou takest no knowledge? Behold, in the day of your fast ye find pleasure, and exact all your labours.
verses.ct: They say, 'Why have we gone without food, and you don't even notice? Why have we denied ourselves, and you pay no attention?' Look — on the very day you fast, you pursue your own interests and exploit all your workers.

verses.kjv: Behold, ye fast for strife and debate, and to smite with the fist of wickedness: ye shall not fast as ye do this day, to make your voice to be heard on high.
verses.ct: Look — your fasting leads to arguments and conflict, and you end up striking each other with cruel fists. You cannot fast the way you do today and expect your voice to be heard in heaven.

verses.kjv: Is it such a fast that I have chosen? a day for a man to afflict his soul? is it to bow down his head as a bulrush, and to spread sackcloth and ashes under him? wilt thou call this a fast, and an acceptable day to the LORD?
verses.ct: Is this really the kind of fast I want? Just a day for someone to deny themselves? Is it about hanging your head like a reed and lying on rough cloth and ashes? Would you call that a fast — a day that pleases the LORD?

verses.kjv: Is not this the fast that I have chosen? to loose the bands of wickedness, to undo the heavy burdens, and to let the oppressed go free, and that ye break every yoke?
verses.ct: No, this is the kind of fast I want: break the chains of injustice, untie the ropes of oppression, set free those who are crushed, and shatter every yoke of burden.

verses.kjv: Is it not to deal thy bread to the hungry, and that thou bring the poor that are cast out to thy house? when thou seest the naked, that thou cover him; and that thou hide not thyself from thine own flesh?
verses.ct: Share your food with the hungry, bring the homeless poor into your house, clothe the person you see without anything to wear, and don't turn your back on your own relatives.

verses.kjv: Then shall thy light break forth as the morning, and thine health shall spring forth speedily: and thy righteousness shall go before thee; the glory of the LORD shall be thy rereward.
verses.ct: Then your light will burst out like the dawn, and your healing will come quickly. Your righteousness will go ahead of you, and the glory of the LORD will guard you from behind.

verses.kjv: Then shalt thou call, and the LORD shall answer; thou shalt cry, and he shall say, Here I am. If thou take away from the midst of thee the yoke, the putting forth of the finger, and speaking vanity;
verses.ct: Then you will call out, and the LORD will respond. You will cry for help, and he will say, 'I am here.' If you remove oppression from among you, stop pointing the finger in accusation, and quit speaking maliciously —

verses.kjv: And if thou draw out thy soul to the hungry, and satisfy the afflicted soul; then shall thy light rise in obscurity, and thy darkness be as the noon day:
verses.ct: if you pour yourself out for the hungry and meet the needs of those who are suffering — then your light will shine in the darkness, and your deepest night will become like midday.

verses.kjv: And the LORD shall guide thee continually, and satisfy thy soul in drought, and make fat thy bones: and thou shalt be like a watered garden, and like a spring of water, whose waters fail not.
verses.ct: The LORD will guide you always. He will satisfy your soul even in dry and barren places and strengthen your body. You will be like a well-watered garden, like a spring whose water never runs dry.

verses.kjv: And they that shall be of thee shall build the old waste places: thou shalt raise up the foundations of many generations; and thou shalt be called, The repairer of the breach, The restorer of paths to dwell in.
verses.ct: Your descendants will rebuild the ancient ruins. You will restore foundations laid long ago. People will call you 'The Repairer of Broken Walls' and 'The Restorer of Streets Where People Live.'

verses.kjv: If thou turn away thy foot from the sabbath, from doing thy pleasure on my holy day; and call the sabbath a delight, the holy of the LORD, honourable; and shalt honour him, not doing thine own ways, nor finding thine own pleasure, nor speaking thine own words:
verses.ct: If you keep your feet from trampling the Sabbath — from pursuing your own interests on my holy day — if you call the Sabbath a delight and treat the LORD's holy day as honorable, if you honor it by not going your own way, not chasing your own agenda, and not engaging in idle talk —

verses.kjv: Then shalt thou delight thyself in the LORD; and I will cause thee to ride upon the high places of the earth, and feed thee with the heritage of Jacob thy father: for the mouth of the LORD hath spoken it.
verses.ct: then you will find your joy in the LORD, and I will let you ride on the heights of the earth. I will nourish you with the inheritance of your ancestor Jacob. The LORD himself has spoken this.
